summary: Email chain between attorney Gloria Allred and a federal prosecutor regarding scheduling a meeting for an Epstein victim to provide information to the Southern District of New York. The correspondence shows coordination for the victim's travel and meeting arrangements.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney communicating with federal prosecutors to arrange a meeting for her client, an Epstein victim, to provide information to the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Assistant mentioned as the contact for federal agents to arrange travel details for Allred's client.

connections.description: Allred directs federal agents to contact her assistant Diane Aldrich to arrange travel details for her client.
Attorney-prosecutor communication regarding scheduling a meeting for an Epstein victim to provide information to federal investigators.

events.title: Scheduled meeting with Epstein victim
events.description: Planned meeting between federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York and an Epstein victim represented by Gloria Allred.

events.title: Victim declines to meet with prosecutors
events.description: An Epstein victim initially decided not to meet with federal prosecutors, though another victim later agreed to meet.

keyFacts: Attorney Gloria Allred was coordinating with federal prosecutors to have an Epstein victim meet with the Southern District of New York on August 19, 2019.
The victim required travel arrangements from Los Angeles to New York, with Allred offering to have her assistant handle details with federal agents.
Another Epstein victim represented by Allred had previously declined to meet with prosecutors but later changed her mind.
The correspondence shows ongoing investigation by the Southern District of New York into Epstein's crimes in August 2019.
The emails contain confidentiality notices indicating the sensitive nature of the communications regarding victim testimony.
